analyzed: paṭṭhāna pakaraṇa  dhamma anuloma paccanīya tika duka paṭṭhāna pāḷi
translated: The Book of Conditional Relations🔽The Conditional Relations in Accordance with the True Idea (Paṭṭhāna)

original: 16.32. Dassanattika, Hetuduka🔽Dassanena pahātabbaṁ hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nadassanena pahātabbo nahetu dhammo uppajjati
analyzed: dassana ttika hetu duka  dassanena pahātabbam hetum dhammam paṭicca na dassanena pahātabbaḥ na hetu dhammo uppajjati
translated: The Triad-couplet Conditional Relations (Tikadukapaṭṭhānapāḷi)🔽The Section on the Directly-cognized🔽A state that is to be given up through vision and has a root is a condition, as root condition, for a state that is not to be given up through vision and has no root.

original: hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā terasa, ārammaṇe nava …pe… vipāke tīṇi …pe… avigate terasa.🔽Dassanena pahātabbaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nabhāvanāya pahātabbo nanahetu dhammo
analyzed: hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā terasa ārammaṇe nava pe vipāke tīṇi pe avigate terasa  dassanena pahātabbam na hetum dhammam paṭicca na bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ na na hetu dhammaḥ
translated: (In brief.) In the case of root, there are thirteen; in the case of object, nine; … in the case of kamma, three; … in the case of absence, thirteen.🔽A state that is to be given up through vision and has no root is a condition, as root condition, for a state that is to be given up through development and has a root

original: uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā nava, ārammaṇe nava …pe… vipāke tīṇi …pe… avigate nava.
analyzed: uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā nava ārammaṇe nava pe vipāke tīṇi pe avigate nava
translated: and for a state that is not to be given up and has a root. (In brief.) In the case of root, there are nine; in the case of object, nine; … in the case of kamma, three; … in the case of absence, nine.
